articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: General Motors (GM.N) said on Wednesday it will buy back $10 billion in shares and boost its dividend by 33%, even as it cuts spending at its troubled robotaxi unit Cruise and lowered profit expectations following the lengthy auto workers' strike.
articles.title: GM to buy back $10 billion in shares, cut Cruise spending

articles.author: Andrew Chung, John Kruzel
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court is poised on Wednesday to consider the legality of the Securities and Exchange Commission's in-house proceedings to enforce investor-protection laws and impose penalties in a case that could broadly undercut the power of federal agencies.
articles.title: US Supreme Court weighs legality of SEC in-house enforcement

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Philips (PHG.AS) shares fell more than 6% on Wednesday after the U.S. Food and Drug Administration said it is alerting patients about a new safety issue with machines made by the group that are used for treatment of obstructive sleep apnea.
articles.title: US FDA flags new problem with Philips machines, shares fall

articles.author: Leigh Thomas
articles.description: The global economy will slow slightly next year but the risk of a hard landing has subsided despite high levels of debt and uncertainty over interest rates, the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Global growth to slow but avoid a hard landing - OECD

articles.author: Julie Zhu, Zhuzhu Cui
articles.description: Huawei Technologies' (HWT.UL) new smart car software and components firm is set for a valuation of up to 250 billion yuan ($34.67 billion) after it sells stakes to investors including Changan Auto, three people with knowledge of the matter said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Huawei's new smart car firm valued up to $35 bln amid advanced stake talks -sources

articles.author: Maha Dahan, Olesya Astakhova, Alex Lawler
articles.description: OPEC+ is continuing to hold talks on 2024 oil policy, with no delay to a meeting scheduled for Thursday currently expected, two sources from the producer group said on Wednesday.
articles.title: OPEC+ talks continue, no meeting delay currently expected, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Uber (UBER.N) will open up its platform to London's black cabs next year, the ride-hailing firm said on Wednesday, trying to win over the British capital's taxis after a decade of tensions.
articles.title: Uber tries to win over London black cabs

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammemd Salem, Henriette Chacar
articles.description: Hamas and Israel were expected to release more hostages and prisoners on Wednesday, the last day of a prolonged six-day truce in the Gaza Strip conflict, as attention focused on whether mediator Qatar could negotiate another extension.
articles.title: Israel, Hamas due to release more people amid efforts to extend truce

articles.author: James Oliphant, Alexandra Ulmer
articles.description: Nikki Haley is having a moment: The 2024 Republican presidential candidate is seeing a swell in media coverage, new interest from big-dollar donors and increasing chatter that she is poised to make a real run at Donald Trump.
articles.title: Nikki Haley's getting buzz, but faces tough math to beat Trump

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A U.S. military Osprey aircraft crashed into the ocean near Japan's Yakushima island on Wednesday with eight people on board, Japan's coast guard said.
articles.title: US military aircraft crashes into ocean near Japan's Yakushima island - coast guard
